title: How to help high schoolers prepare for the rise of artificial intelligence
summary: MIT's Abdul Latif Jameel Clinic for Machine Learning in Health organized a summer program to educate high school students about the use of artificial intelligence (AI) in healthcare. The program aimed to reach students from diverse backgrounds and offered courses on Python, clinical AI, and drug discovery. The program was made possible through a generous donation and aimed to reduce financial barriers for under-resourced students. The students had the opportunity to interact with MIT faculty and visit local institutions. The program emphasized collaboration across disciplines and inspired students to pursue careers in AI and healthcare.
